title: A period feel
review: Landour Bazaar can be a bottleneck for cars but on foot it reveals hidden gems.  One gets the feeling that if only people would take care of their buildings and environment this could be a stunning place.  Some great antique / curio shops.

title: Only for nature lovers
review: I was on a day trip to landour bazaar . This part of mussoorie has retained its virginity and old world charm . You can breathe the aroma of the flora and fauna which cuts through your breath . It is definitely a place for nature lovers who love their walks . I definitely wish to go and spend a few days there .

title: Landaur Cant Visit
review: Far from the crowds Landour sits above Mussoorie . It has a pristine Victorian Charm to this place as this place is frequented by few of the tourists. Being an Cantonment there no commercial activity except for small local market and few Resorts. This place has still retained its charm and Calm of British Era Hill station.

title: Antique and handicraft shop
review: We bought carpets from Sabri on the slope and wall plates and and handicrafts from Vinod Kumar next to the Clock tower. He has all things you can look for to decorate your house. Be patient and browse slowly. We spent hours here.

title: Peaceful and good
review: Instead of roaming on mall road I thought of having a look at Landour bazaar and I did loved it.

title: nice place
review: the landour bazar is a nice quaint part of mussoorie...a nice church...char dukaan where there are a few shops selling mouth watering bun omelette...maggi etc;...amazing weather...away from the hustle...awesome place to spend some quality time...

title: Down to earth part of Mussoorie
review: This is much down to earth market than Mall and perhaps also much less visited by tourists on a short visit. There are a few good souvenir shops, shops of house hold items, An office of Survey of India attracted my attention but I was not allowed to go inside or take photograph.

title: Nightmare for car drivers
review: We were on our way from Dehradun to Lal Tibba, Mussoorie and crossed Landour Bazaar, which we found extremely tortuous for car drivers, who had to move inch by inch in highly congested bumber to bumber drive.  It is better to park your car and walk the stretch.

title: Secluded walk amidst the Deodar trees
review: Landour was such a pleasant experience after looking at the over commercialized Mussoorie. Away from the crowd, all secluded. Wonderful cobbled Street to walk on. Stunning view of Deodar trees around to make the ambience all the more special. And some amazing cafes around. The only regret is that we didn't stay here.

title: Landour Bazaar
review: Where Mall Road in Mussoorie is over crowded, landour gives you perfect resort. Peaceful, scenic and clouds over your head is what makes this place awesome. It is also famous for char dukaan, Lal tibba, Landour Bakery House, church and rockby manor (visit for awesome food). I love it.

title: Secluded place in lap of nature
review: Very quite place.

title: Nothing Much Too See
review: You have Walk Long and You will find Few old Shops, 1 clock tower, dirt. not much a attraction to see.

title: Awesome
review: A must visit... nice leisure walk along the streets... old and new shops.. taking one through decades of history..

title: Not at all worth visiting
review: There is no place such as landour bazaar. It's a very small part of Mall Road Mussoorie. Nthng to visit it specially. If smeone really wants to visit it, one can visit it before entering d Mall Road as it is on d extreme outer part of Mall Road.

title: Great place to explore walking
review: Landour and its bazaar area are a little bit of a climb from the Mall Road.

title: Quiet and Desolate (a rarity for India)
review: There is not very much to do up here; so please don't come if your intention is to bring your diesel chugging automobiles, your loud and vulgarities laden language and most of all your (or your driver's) litter.  This is a gorgeous part of Mussoorie where their is little more to do than walk in the clean air and observe the awesomeness of the nature around you.

title: Leisurely walk up the old bazaars
review: Landour bazar located some distance away from the Mall can be best explored walking.

title: Look for Roman Sandals
review: Landour Bazaar is just like every other small town bazaar but hilly terrain and simple people make it interesting to walk through. If it is raining or you are feeling cold you can stop by to have tea and samosa or even enjoy tasty jalebis. There are four cobbler stores as you go downhill in the bazaar who make shoes and sandals on order.  Quality is good. You can look for buying Roman Sandals from them if you are fan of one. They have ready peaces too but can give a customized one in a day or two.

title: peaceful place
review: landour which is some kms away from the famous hill station mussoorie is the ideal place for people who want to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the city life! The place does not attract much crowd as this is an off beat place! One can see the place by walking which is just 3-4 kms, char dukaan is quite famous there!

title: old quaint untouched
review: old, quaint and untouched in years.. you will see houses here which feel like if you step in they will wither and fall apart but they have been standing there for decades and maybe more. the thin lanes, the close knit community.. its the place where everyone knows everyone. its a steep climb up but a refreshing and rewarding one.

title: Chardukaan
review: This is perhaps the most peaceful eatery/cafe I have ever visited. You can get a cup of coffee and momos in under 50 rs and enjoy birds chirping with an amazing view while you do so

title: Chaardukaan - The best Cafe
review: This cafe is situated on the way to Lal Tibba on a hill. You sit, relax and breathe in the fresh air around. I think this is what adds to this cafe's USP.

title: Busy market
review: Narrow roads with shops on both sides. People living in city will be finding it difficult to understand that it is a local market. Nice place with variety of shops. I bought a lot of shoes from here.

title: Quaint
review: God bless this place called landaur. Given the mess that Mussorrie has become am glad this place ticked away a few kms away is pristine and will be so. The army cantt that it is regulates everything so over the top construction and related activities will not be here. Great place for a non commercial lazing holiday. Lovely stretch to walk and talk to people and basically everything that you do not do at home. Cannot get over this beauty. Small narrow and steep roads. Meaning this holiday if properly done, burns a lot of calories.

title: Better scenery than mussorie, better shopping in mussoorie
review: The bazaar is more for locals. You get good daily need stuff like milk n groceries, not really good shopping for tourists. On the other hand, the scenic beauty is all the more better with less traffic n less touristy feeling. Go there for the beauty not the bazaar

title: Walk and walk in Ruskin Bond country..............
review: One who loves walking will find the place interesting in the midst of the sloppy ridges and the rugged roads and people......saw quaint little shops and also some which sell Raj memorabilia...the old photographs,lanterns,wine -decanters,chandeliars,rare old books furniture and curios.....a  collection from the bygone era.......the shops sell bangles and ladies wares and local handicrafts........a tea at a way side joint is most refreshing.....this is the place you slowly go up and up and the charming little british cottages beckon you.......Ruskin Bond the world famous writer stays close......

title: Enjoy serenity
review: You are at top with Devdars ....place of Ruskin bond ....and walking on the roads ....seeing two old churches ....eating in famous char dukan ....n witnessing spots of shooting

title: Way Up There amongst the Clouds
review: Not quite in the Clouds but the walk around the back side will, on a clear day give you views of those great mountains, the Himalayas.  Not as long as the Camels Back Road nonetheless is does provide an opportunity for some quiet time.  Being a clear day the views were ' a Sight to Behold'.  Quite the ride up and down those narrow roads

title: the walk and the beauty!
review: person who loves to walk will surely enjoy the area around..i had no intention of buying anything but enjoyed visiting shops and show-room...it was really fun!

title: The best place to shop in India (back in 1850)
review: Landour Bazaar is a bit removed from where most of the tourist traffic is, and yet it still offers almost everything you might need.

title: Char Dukan! not exactly.
review: we visited this place in Aug'13. the place consist of around 5-6 shops serving snacks, maggi, tea etc

title: good
review: landour is probably at the top of mussoorie. it is good to see that there are few shops who caters for daily needs.

title: Lovely Landour Bazaar
review: Landour is a very beautiful place. The Landour Bazaar is a decent place where items related to daily needs can be found in Chaar Dukan  ... a place of a few shops. One can get good, homely momos in there. Near this bazaar, there is a church with a nice lawn. Just take a walk and eventually one would find the beautiful range of the Himalayas and the snow capped peaks. Overall it is a very calm & quite place though the heart will be filled up with chirping of the rare birds in early morning.

title: When in Mussorie, dont forget to visit this place
review: If I go to Mussorie, I make sure that one of my day is spent at Char dukan area.

title: Char dukan
review: Bcs at 1 time there were only 4 shops. Grt place to eat. Bt do go ahead u will find laal tibba. Ahead of that a graveyard with century old graves. After that mr.baneerji's property, and beyond that blissss. A view to kill fr.

title: A peaceful stay  !!
review: If you are looking for peaceful stay in Uttranchal and want to escape from busy Mussoorie then stay here in Landour area, this one of the best place to stay. Stay on top of the city and such a peaceful area and dont forget to go char bazar for tasty food.

title: Nice Hill Station
review: This is situated near Mussorie. This is in higher elevation than Mussorie. We had a tour with my family and friends. We stayed there a bank gauste house . The Guste house is spacious with front lawn and clear view of hills from here. We have enjoyed too much. The road is very stif , so drive with care or hire local driver or local car. You can treak here in hilly road also market is good for winter cloths and germents. I enjoy better than Mussorie.

title: too overcrowded
review: We went on long weekend, it was Jam all the way.. too over crowded for our liking. Looked nice place although.

title: Decent Bazaar
review: Landour Bazaar in Mussoorie is very near to Mall Road, nice market on this bazar, famous restaurants are there, banks and popular chemist shops are here, Domino's is also here, you can enjoy corns chaiwalas seating around. Famous lovely omelette wala is also here.

title: Market for the locals
review: This is the market designed for the locals which is small and cute at the same time. Although it is small, it accommodates a large collection of shopping materials with a number of eateries. This place has a capacity to attract large number of tourists.

title: Amazing place.... serene
review: A very calm place, best suited for people who wish to relax and getaway from honking cities. Only two hotels are present at the top of hill, one owned by DRDO while the other is a five star hotel. Once can also easily walk by the road from Mall road to this hill top within 45 minutes.

title: Lovely walk and views - might tire you out though!
review: Landour is a lovely little section of Mussoorie. It has lovely views, some interesting shops and is very quiet, even on weekends.

title: First the bun omlette and lemon tea, then the sight seeing
review: A family trip to Landour with a close friend. We just had to have the bun omlette a couple of times each and the lemon tea before we continued to Lal Tibba.

title: the place is popular for bun omelette of Anil
review: place popular for bun omelette at Anil's, one should give it a try, the trek from mall road is a bit tiring, you can rent scooters and bikes from Doma's which is on the way.
